1.text: Set the trumpet to your mouth. He shall come as an eagle against the house of the LORD, because they have transgressed my covenant, and trespassed against my law.

2.text: Israel shall cry to me, My God, we know you.

3.text: Israel has cast off the thing that is good: the enemy shall pursue him.

4.text: They have set up kings, but not by me: they have made princes, and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols, that they may be cut off.

5.text: Your calf, O Samaria, has cast you off; my anger is kindled against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocence?

6.text: For from Israel was it also: the workman made it; therefore it is not God: but the calf of Samaria shall be broken in pieces.

7.text: For they have sown the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind: it has no stalk; the bud shall yield no meal: if so be it yield, the strangers shall swallow it up.

8.text: Israel is swallowed up: now shall they be among the Gentiles as a vessel wherein is no pleasure.

9.text: For they are gone up to Assyria, a wild ass alone by himself: Ephraim has hired lovers.

10.text: Yes, though they have hired among the nations, now will I gather them, and they shall sorrow a little for the burden of the king of princes.

11.text: Because Ephraim has made many altars to sin, altars shall be to him to sin.

12.text: I have written to him the great things of my law, but they were counted as a strange thing.

13.text: They sacrifice flesh for the sacrifices of my offerings, and eat it; but the LORD accepts them not; now will he remember their iniquity, and visit their sins: they shall return to Egypt.

14.text: For Israel has forgotten his Maker, and builds temples; and Judah has multiplied fenced cities: but I will send a fire on his cities, and it shall devour the palaces thereof.
